newsitem.title: CHINA: Unicom to lay China's longest telecom trunk.
newsitem.headline: Unicom to lay China's longest telecom trunk.

text.p: United Telecom (Unicom) will lay a 7,050-km (4,380-mile) underwater cable -- China's longest telecom trunk -- linking Beijing and 27 major coastal cities, the Xinhua news agency said on Monday.
The project would involve investment of 2.0 billion yuan ($241 million) and add 150,000 telephone lines to national capacity, Xinhua said.
Unicom and Japan's NEC Corp signed a cooperation contract on August 12, the agency said without giving details of the deal.
The cable would run between the northeastern industrial city of Dandong in Liaoning province and Beihai in the southern province of Guangxi, it said.

A section of the cable, measuring 110 km (68 miles) and connecting Shenzhen and Zhuhai in southern Guangdong province, would cost $4.2 million, Xinhua said. Construction of the Shenzhen-Zhuhai section was scheduled to be completed within six months.
